meanings.definition: To live on or in a host organism and obtain nutrients at the host's expense.
meanings.sent1: The tiny insect can parasitize the larger animal by feeding on its blood.
meanings.sent2: Certain plants parasitize nearby trees to get the nutrients they need.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky parasite decided to parasitize the lazy host for an easy meal.
meanings.sent4: The idea of toxic relationships can parasitize one's mental well-being.
meanings.sent5: The concept of freeloaders can be likened to how some organisms parasitize others for survival.

meanings.definition: To exploit the hospitality of others for one's own benefit.
meanings.sent1: Some people tend to parasitize their friends by always asking for favors.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to parasitize someone's generosity without giving back.
meanings.sent3: The clever guest managed to parasitize the party host's snacks all night.
meanings.sent4: Her charisma allowed her to parasitize the goodwill of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The politician's promises seemed to parasitize the hopes of the citizens.
